metadata.Title: CVE-2022-27382 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
MariaDB Server v10.7 and below was discovered to contain a segmentationfault via the componentItem_field::used_tables/update_depend_map_for_order.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-27382` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadb3 - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libmariadbd19 - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-backup - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-client - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-client-10.6 - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-client-core-10.6 - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-common - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-plugin-rocksdb - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-plugin-s3 - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-server - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-server-10.6 - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-server-core-10.6 - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-test - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
mariadb-test-data - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.6 package in esm-apps/jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
